info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected around Boulder City and Lake Mead National Recreation Area. * WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 458 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding may already be occurring on Lakeshore Scenic Drive. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Lakeshore Scenic Drive is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... East Henderson, Boulder City, Las Vegas Bay, Lake Las Vegas, Boulder Beach, Boulder Beach Campground, Railroad Pass and Las Vegas Bay Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
